scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
SOAP 1.2 is included in 2 national catalogues of recommended specifications. They belong to the Netherlands and Spain. The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of these Member States is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO)factsheets.

See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
According to the 5 star Open Data model suggested by Tim Berners-Lee about how to publish linked data, the second star corresponds to make data available as structured data, an area of application of SOAP 1.2.

In addition, SOAP 1.2 serialisation provides several advantages, especially if the Semantic Web is not just about providing metadata for existing web pages, but also about exchange of content that is machine-readable.  

See:
https://5stardata.info/en/
https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/dbf2/6496e5b3087b708d4c00883c6470b53ff8d8.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specificationÂ
statement:
W3C has a defined and publicly available Process for the Development and approval process of the specification as a recommended standard. Also, a clear Release Notes tracking the changes of the different versions is archived.

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/2018/Process-20180201/#Policies

statement:
W3C has a defined and publicly available Process for the Development and approval process of the specification as a recommended standard, including a public review.

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/2018/Process-20180201/#Policies

statement:
SOAP 1.2 is publicly available for implementation and study for free on W3C's webpage. 

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/soap12/

statement:
The W3C Royalty-Free IPR licenses granted under the W3C Patent Policy apply to all W3C specifications, including SOAP 1.2.

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/patent-practice#ref-AC

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is sufficiently mature and has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification is a widely used de-facto standard. It was launched for the first time in 1998 by engineers from Microsoft. Other companies with a wide market share are contributed to the development of the specification. Additionally, SOAP is developed and maintained by W3C and its working group. Thus, it is sufficiently mature for the development of products and services.

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/soap12/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement: Nowadays, SOAP 1.2 is a de-facto messaging protocol for exchanging information in a structured way, and invoke web services SOAP-based. It is used in a wide variety of solutions, while REST is widely used as well, SOAP remains as one of the main protocol to implement SOAs, and this fact includes innovative solutions.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
SOAP 1.2 is maintained by W3C which is an international community developing open standards. 

See:
https://www.w3.org/Consortium/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the visibility and comprehensibility of administrative rules, processes, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
SOAP 1.2 is a messaging protocol for exchanging information in a structured way, it uses XML for its message format. As the protocol is a messaging system for exchanging information in a structured way, it helps to promote the visibility and comprehensibility of the administrative rules. In addition, it is a key enabler for web services reuse across borders along with UDDI and WSDL. 

See:
https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/en/SSAW57_8.5.5/com.ibm.websphere.nd.multiplatform.doc/ae/cwbs_soapverdiffs.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification helps ensuring the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement:
SOAP 1.2 is a messaging protocol for exchanging information in a structured way, it provides endpoints that foster the availability of interfaces containing data from internal information systems of a public administration.

See:
https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/en/SSAW57_8.5.5/com.ibm.websphere.nd.multiplatform.doc/ae/cwbs_soapverdiffs.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.Â
statement: SOAP 1.2 is a sector domain agnostic specification that can be used independently from the business domain.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard has been made available for its reuse by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.
statement:
SOAP 1.2 is publicly available for implementation and use for free on W3C's webpage. Therefore it can be reused by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/soap12/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is independent from any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
SOAP 1.2 can be used independently from any other technical specifications or operating system. As is shown in the SOAP 1.2 FAQ from W3C, SOAP can be adopted with no dependence on WSDL.

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/soap12/
https://www.w3.org/2003/06/soap12faq.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
SOAP 1.2 is a protocol intended for exchanging structured information in a decentralized, distributed environment. SOAP uses XML technologies to define an extensible messaging framework providing a message construct that can be exchanged over a variety of underlying protocols. It can be concluded that it is proportionate to the users' needs as it helps to the well functioning of citizens, businesses and administrations.

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/soap12/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
The purpose of SOAP 1.2 is to store, transport and exchange data through interoperable systems. Moreover, SOAP 1.2 uses XML which defines a set of rules for encoding documents in a human-readable format and machine-readable format enhancing the reusability of data and stimulating the interoperability of systems and services.  

Additionally, W3C develops its specification independently from any vendor. Thus, the adoption of SOAP 1.2 does not hamper the data portability of data expressed with it. In fact, the adoption of SOAP endorses the binding and invoking of web services allowing data exchange across borders.

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml11-20060816/
https://www.w3.org/TR/soap12/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement: The application of the once-only principle in all EU Member States public administrations aims at reducing the administrative burden. To achieve this, interoperability between public administrations is a sine qua non condition. SOAP addresses and facilitates the exchanging of information within cross border services and impacts positively the development of eGovernment.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement: The purpose of SOAP 1.2 is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement: The purpose of SOAP 1.2 is not related to security and privacy. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement: The purpose of SOAP 1.2 is not related to the  delivery of multilingual public services. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The adoption of the standard or specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement: The purpose of the specification addresses and facilitates the exchanging of information. By allowing to make web services available and the data exchange between systems from administrations and stakeholders, SOAP fosters the reduction of administrative burden.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement: The purpose of SOAP 1.2 is not related to the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the standard or specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are several studies assessing SOAP 1.2 performance and features in terms of efficiency and efficacy. As REST and SOAP-based web services are living together nowadays, one of the topics is the performance comparison. Moreover, the comparison between different SOAP toolkits is an exploited topic. 

See: 
https://aaltodoc.aalto.fi/bitstream/handle/123456789/29224/master_Makkonen_Joni_2017.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y 
https://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=1033266

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification can be mapped to the EIRA.
statement:
SOAP 1.2 is associated to an EIRA ABB in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, SOAP 1.2 can define the interoperability aspects of the "Machine to Machine Interface", "Data Exchange Component" and, âData Exchange Serviceâ ABBs from the EIRA Technical Infrastructure view.

See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/release/eira-library-interoperability-specifications-elis/v100-beta

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the standard or specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
W3C provides a Markup Validation Service for free to validate SOAP 1.2 implementations.

See:
https://validator.w3.org/feed/docs/soap.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is recommended by a EU Member State.
statement:
8 Member States are recommending JSON in their ICT National Catalogues. 
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been selected for its use in a EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
SOAP 1.2 has been included within several European cross-border initiatives as can be read in the European Interoperability Architecture (EIA) called Common Vision for an EIA. 

e-SENSE, e-PSOS or SPOCS are initiatives that implemented SOAP 1.2 in order to carry out their purposes. All the projects are related to the enhancement of interoperability between European administrations across borders and across sectors. 

See:
https://ec.europa.eu/isa2/sites/isa/files/isa_2.1_eia-finalreport-commonvisionforane
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_sr/019000_019099/019050/01.01.01_60/sr_019050v010101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
The specification is included in 8 Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications. Some examples of Member States including SOAP on their catalogues are the Netherlands, Spain or France.
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
The specification is not included per se in any supra-national catalogue. Despite this, SOAP 1.2 is part of the Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI); Rationalized framework of Standards for Electronic Registered Delivery Services Applying Electronic Signatures, which is an ETSI Special Report. 

See:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_sr/019000_019099/019050/01.01.01_60/sr_019050v010101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
The SOAP 1.2 is included in the  European Interoperability Architecture (EIA) study explores the need for a European interoperability architecture facilitating the establishment of European public services (cross border eGovernment services). The document includes references to the Reference Interoperability agreement(RIA), where SOAP can be mapped with the technical agreement for â Agreement on the technical connection aspects for electronic data Exchangeâ in the context of epSOS Project. 

See:
https://ec.europa.eu/isa2/sites/isa/files/isa_2.1_eia-finalreport-commonvisionforaneia.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement: After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling standard or specification.
statement: The purpose of SOAP 1.2 is not related  to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement: The purpose of SOAP 1.2 is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
SOAP is defining a data model, which represents application-defined data structures and values as a directed edge-labelled graph of nodes. Therefore, as a sector agnostic specification, SOAP defines a cross-sector reusable data model. 
See: 
https://www.w3.org/TR/2007/REC-soap12-part2-20070427/#datamodel

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
According to the 5 star Open Data model suggested by Tim Berners-Lee about how to publish linked data, the second star corresponds to make data available as structured data, an area of application of SOAP 1.2.

In addition, SOAP 1.2 serialisation provides several advantages, especially if the Semantic Web is not just about providing meta data for existing web pages, but also about exchange of content that is machine-readable.  

See:
https://5stardata.info/en/
https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/dbf2/6496e5b3087b708d4c00883c6470b53ff8d8.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
SOAP 1.2 is available for free at the European Collaborative platform for the development of ICT solutions. 
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/soap-version-12-part-0-primer
